cab.content: Printed for the Cabinet. February 1938.SECRET. Copy No.CP. 31 (38).CABINET.PROPOSED APPOINTMENT OF IRISH MINISTER IN ROME.Note by the Secretary of State for Dominion Affairs.Mr. DULANTY came to see me last Friday to tell me that Mr. de Valera has been doing his best to meet the informal representations which Mr. Eden and I made to him regarding the appointment of a Minister in Rome (see OP. 12 (38) ). It has now been arranged that Mr. Mac White, the Minister Designate, should not go to Rome for " six or seven weeks " from now.M. M.February 14, 1938.[16701J
